title: Keynote Lecture International Manufacturing Forum Series 2021
content: Abdallah Kamhawi is a dual degree student in Master of Science in Digital and Material Technologies and Master of Architecture at the University of Michigan’s Taubman College of Architecture and Urban Planning. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Architectural Engineering from Ain Shams University in Egypt. Abdallah has worked professionally with firms in the Middle East on various project types and scales. He is interested in exploring the potentials of computational design methods and digital fabrication technologies to improve the built environment.

title: $1.58M NSF Grant to Explore Human–Robot Collaborative Construction
content: The National Science Foundation (NSF) has awarded a grant totalling $2 million to an interdisciplinary research team, which includes Taubman College faculty Wes McGee and Arash Adel, to explore robotic partnerships in construction work. The project, “Collaborative Research: Partnering Workers with Interactive Robot Assistants to Usher Transformation in Future Construction Work,” envisions that intelligent human-robot teams have the potential to increase productivity and streamline processes, thereby transforming the profile of future construction workers and resulting in new career opportunities and significant benefits to the industry.
